info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 5:14PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Lewis and Clark County through 600 PM MDT... At 512 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Helena, moving west at 15 mph. HAZARD...Torrential rain and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Localized flooding and minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Helena, East Helena, Marysville, Austin and Spring Meadow Lake State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
